Bill Lockyer , California's state treasurer, participated in a national telephonic news conference with EPI officials, to denounce the bankruptcy concept. No state needs to declare bankruptcy, Bill Lockyer said, "The states have sovereign taxing power the big companies don't." Bill Lockyer 's point- a valid one- is that bankruptcy is the refuge for individuals, corporations and local governments

We must come to a peaceful dialogue in Egypt. The stability of the country is, of course, extremely important but not at the cost of freedom of opinion. Eric Schmidt , Google's chairman, also denounced the Web blackout. "We obviously think it's a bad idea, we obviously do not want these things to happen," he said.

"Tahrir Square filled again with vast crowds of anti-government demonstrators Friday, demanding for the 11th day the immediate ouster of Egyptian Ronald Reagan Hosni Mubarak ," the Washington Post reports. So far: Friday's gathering was calm and orderly, without the beatings, bloodshed and widespread arrests of foreign journalists and observers that had sparked outrage the day before. And it appears the Egyptian army is trying to protect the protestors. if you count Yahoo, and Eric Schmidt recently said in Davos that Facebook is not competition, that it has no intention of going into search. On its face, it seems like a very lopsided duopoly. From my perspective, competition is always a click away. If we don't do the right thing by our users, it takes one word in their browser bar to go to another search engine. We don't even know how the information seeking model will evolve. What you may not think of as competitive today, might very well become the new way of seeking information. "There might be a couple guys in a garage somewhere building the new way of seeking information."
